articles.name: Announcing the End User Separation EAP for department spaces
articles.title: Announcing the End User Separation EAP for department spaces
articles.body:
Customers using the department spaces feature can now sign up to restrict agent access to end users by brand. This early access program (EAP) has a limited scope and aims to gather product feedback.

This announcement includes the following topics: 

  • What's changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What's changing?

End user separation, a follow-on to the department spaces feature launch, enables administrators to segment agent access to end users based on the agents' department membership.

To participate in the early access program, simply fill out this form. Once you’ve completed it, we’ll be in touch with you. 

Why is Zendesk making this change?

This ensures focused support, enhances data privacy, and promotes specialized product knowledge. With this EAP, agents' ticket access AND end user access will depend on their department membership. Zendesk admins will automatically belong to all departments.

What do I need to do?

First, confirm that you have department spaces on your account. (To check, go to Admin Center > Team members. If you see a ‘Brands’ column, then department spaces is enabled on your account.) Then, sign up for the EAP. 

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-08-22
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-08-22
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • Copilot
  • AI Agents Advanced
  • App Marketplace
  • Products with no updates this week

Copilot

New:

  • We’ve introduced the ability for admins to add existing macros in auto assist procedures. This means that auto assist can suggest macros to agents.

AI Agents Advanced

New:

  • API integration parent blocks in the dialogue builder now allow hiding and disabling "Collect parameter" branches with a single click.
  • All sortable elements in the dialogue builder now use the same UI component, allowing for changing the order of child blocks of conditional and customer message blocks.
     

Fixed:

  • Translation-related issues on the Segments page have been fixed.

App Marketplace

New:
  • HelloSend (Support)
    • HelloSend is a unified customer communication platform built for modern teams. It helps businesses streamline conversations across SMS, WhatsApp, and voice — all from one place. Trusted by growing teams worldwide, HelloSend simplifies messaging with powerful automation and deep CRM integrations.  Easily send and receive SMS and WhatsApp messages from Zendesk tickets.  Make and receive voice calls with automatic ticket logging and call recording. View complete conversation history for better ticket context.
  • MaskDots (Support)
    • MaskDots is an intelligent data privacy app that automatically detects and masks sensitive information in your documents and systems. Built for organizations that handle confidential data, it combines advanced AI technology with user-friendly features to protect sensitive information while maintaining productivity.   Automatically identify sensitive data across multiple categories, such as financial information, personal identifiers, industry-specific data, and even custom patterns that you define.  
  • Omni Task Manager (Support) (paid)
    • Omni Task Manager is your all-in-one solution for organizing, tracking, and achieving more. It helps you simplify complex projects by breaking them into subtasks tailored to each team's expertise. Assign subtasks to the right agents, streamline collaboration with comments, and set due dates to stay on track. Perfect for managing detailed projects while keeping your team aligned and productive.  Seamlessly link tasks with Zendesk tickets, enabling updates on tickets directly from task updates for streamlined workflows.
  • RevenueCat Customer Profiles (Support)
    • RevenueCat Customer Profiles integrates your subscription data directly into the Zendesk Support interface, displaying critical customer information in the sidebar to save your support team valuable time. View customer subscription status, purchase history, and account details without leaving Zendesk. Eliminate the need to switch between Zendesk and RevenueCat dashboards.  
  • Translator AI (Support) (paid)
    • Translator AI is a simple yet powerful Zendesk app that streamlines multilingual customer support. It automatically detects languages and translates either outgoing agent replies or incoming customer messages, ensuring clear communication without switching tools. If the ticket editor contains text, Translator AI detects the source language and translates it into the customer's language, replacing the editor content so agents can send it immediately. If the ticket editor is empty, Translator AI translates the most recent public customer message into the agent's language and posts it as an internal note for easy reading and response.

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Admin Center
  • Talk
  • Knowledge
  • Messaging and live chat
  • Mobile
  • Zendesk Workflow Management (WFM)
  • Explore
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: Announcing enhanced dynamic filtering for lookup relationships
articles.title: Announcing enhanced dynamic filtering for lookup relationships
articles.body:
Announced on Rollout starts Rollout ends
August 26, 2025 August 26, 2025 August 29, 2025

Zendesk is pleased to announce the availability of dynamic filtering options for lookup relationship fields across standard and custom objects. 

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

Until now, dynamic filtering of lookup relationship fields was only supported for ticket lookup relationship fields based on standard ticket fields, such as Requester, Organization, and Assignee. This was powerful because it provided a way to filter custom object records to only those associated with those fields, such as only being able to select the ticket requester's orders.

However, Zendesk contains a lot of data across many objects and fields that can provide just as much usefulness in filtering. Therefore, you can now build filter data availability in all lookup relationship fields, across all objects.

Additionally, two new operators are now supported for filtering lookup relationship field values: matches and does not match. This makes it possible to include or exclude records based on any field's value. For example, if a ticket has a dropdown field named Product category and a lookup field named Product, it is possible to configure the Product field to only allow the selection of products that match the value in the ticket's Product category field. This sort of filtering on lookup relationship fields can significantly improve the agent and end-user experiences because it displays only relevant options, therein reducing errors and increasing efficiency.

Note: Any existing filters on lookup relationship fields that use the is operator to compare field values to the Requester, Assignee, Organization, or Current user fields will be automatically converted to use the matches operator. They will continue to operate as expected.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

Zendesk received very positive responses to being able to filter ticket lookup relationship fields based on standard ticket fields, which lead to numerous requests for the same functionality for their custom data. Extending support for dynamic filtering to all objects and custom fields as well as adding the new operators means admins can create rich, multi-tiered catalogs and forms throughout Zendesk without needing to write any code.

What do I need to do?

This functionality is available to all accounts. To begin using these features, add or update your lookup relationship fields and configure the field's filtering options.

While this update is available to accounts on all Guide themes, accounts using guide templating version 4 might need to refresh your theme to access these changes. See About templating versions for help center themes.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Can I edit custom ticket fields on closed tickets?
articles.title: Can I edit custom ticket fields on closed tickets?
articles.body:
Question

Can I edit custom ticket fields on closed tickets?

Answer

Currently, you can edit some of the custom fields on closed tickets. The fields that you can’t edit appear grayed out. Below is a list of the field types that you can't edit:

-Credit card
-Number
-Regex
-Lookup
-Due date
-Multi-line

For more information, see this article: Modifying closed tickets

articles.name: Announcing API support for WhatsApp Flows
articles.title: Announcing API support for WhatsApp Flows
articles.body:
We’re thrilled to announce that WhatsApp Flows are officially supported by the Sunshine Conversations API. With Flows, you can create bespoke conversational experiences that are native to WhatsApp, whether its for triaging tickets, collecting new leads, or providing tailored product recommendations -- you can do it all with Flows.

What are WhatsApp Flows?

WhatsApp Flows are a type of WhatsApp Message Template that are highly interactive. They enable your business to send rich, multi-step, templated messages for collecting data. 

What do I need to do?

Because support for Flows is being released as an API-first feature, you'll need access to the Sunshine Conversations API and have your own webhook URL configured to receive the events containing the Flow response. Access to the Messaging platform is available to customers on the Suite Professional or Enterprise plans.

What are the pricing implications?

The use of Flows as described below will count toward your MAUs and may also count towards your Notification API usage, depending on how the Flows are sent. Both of these platform usage fees are billed through Zendesk. Additionally, WhatsApp Message Template fees apply for the use of Flows. For most customers, Zendesk will pass-through the charges to our customers on behalf of WhatsApp. 

How does it work?

  1. Create your desired Flow through your WhatsApp Business Account under the Message template section.
  2. Once your new Flow is approved by Meta, you can send it programmatically to your customers via our Notification API or Sending Flows Using Override option, depending on if the customer already has an open conversation with the business or not.
  3. Once your customer completes the Flow, their responses are sent back to you through Sunshine Conversations via a passthrough:messaging webhook event. You can then use this webhook to automate the next steps in the conversation based on their answers.
    • Please make sure that you update your webhooks to start listening for this new event.
    • The response_json section of the event is where you'll find your customer's replies to the questions in your Flow.

What's next

We'll be working on making Flows available out-of-the-box for customers who would like to use them with their AI agents (Advanced or Essential). Additionally, we plan to add support for agents to be able to manually trigger and receive Flow responses directly in the conversation view.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Workflow: How to hide the article suggestion search when an end user submits a support request
articles.title: Workflow: How to hide the article suggestion search when an end user submits a support request
articles.body:
In this tutorial, you'll learn how to hide the article suggestions that display in the contact form of the help center when an end user types in the subject of the request.

The workflow includes the steps below.

  • Step 1: Verify the prerequisites
  • Step 2: Make a copy of the theme
  • Step 3: Edit the CSS file
  • Step 4: Edit the CSS code to hide the article suggestions

Step 1: Verify the prerequisites

This change requires you to edit the theme code of the help center and is only available on Suite Growth plans or higher.

Step 2: Make a copy of the theme

Before you make changes to your live theme, make a copy of the theme and update the copied version.

Step 3:  Edit the CSS file

Edit the CSS file of your help center theme.

Step 4: Edit the CSS code to hide the article suggestions

  1. Search for the words suggestion-list

  2. Replace the code or with the following snippet in your CSS file
     

    .form .suggestion-list {

display:none;

}

.form .suggestion-list label {

display:none;

}

.form .suggestion-list li {

display:none;

}

.form .suggestion-list li a:visited {

display:none;

}
  3. Click Publish to save the changes
Disclaimer: This article is provided for instructional purposes only. Zendesk does not support or guarantee custom code. Zendesk also can't provide support for third-party technologies such as JavaScript, jQuery, or CSS. Post any issues you have in the comments section or try searching for a solution online.

For more information, see the following articles:

  • What are the differences between Instant Search, Article Suggestion, and Help Center search?
  • Understanding help center search methods

articles.name: Service Incident - August 18, 2025 - Zendesk QA - QA access issues & 5xx errors
articles.title: Service Incident - August 18, 2025 - Zendesk QA - QA access issues & 5xx errors
articles.body:
SUMMARY

August 19, 2025 14:43 UTC | August 19, 2025 07:43 AM PT

We are pleased to inform you that the issue causing 500 errors when accessing the kibbles.klaus.com URL has been resolved. Our engineers have mitigated the problem, and customers should no longer encounter these errors.
 
We would appreciate your feedback to confirm whether the service is now functioning correctly on your end. Your prompt response will help us provide any further assistance if needed.

August 18, 2025 23:26 UTC | 15:26 PT

We have observed significant improvement from the issue preventing access and causing 5xx level errors in Zendesk QA and are moving to monitor the issue to ensure recovery. We will provide another update when we have reached full resolution.

August 18, 2025 22:25 UTC | 14:25 PT

We are beginning to see improvement in the issue preventing access and causing 5xx level errors when reaching the Zendesk QA product. Please let us know if you continue to experience any issues.

August 18, 2025 22:04 UTC | 14:04 PT

We have confirmed an issues causing 5xx level errors and preventing access to the Zendesk QA product. Our team is investigating and we will provide further updates in the next 30 minutes.

August 18, 2025 21:45 UTC | 13:44 PT

We are receiving reports of access issues and 5xx level errors reaching the QA product across multiple pods. Further information will be posted shortly.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-08-15
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-08-15
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • Admin Center
  • Copilot
  • Mobile
  • App Marketplace
  • Products with no updates this week

Admin Center

New:

  • As part of the removal of support for password access for API authentication, we've proactively turned off and removed this capability for accounts where our records show no usage of the feature for more than the past 90 days.

Copilot

New:

  • A new tab with auto assist usage data is now available on the Zendesk Copilot: Agent productivity analytics dashboard.

Mobile

iOS Zendesk SDK v2.33.0

New:

  • Added the public API getCurrentUser() to expose current user information.
  • Updated the minimum iOS version supported to iOS 14: More information here.

Fixed:

  • Resolved an issue where end users could not play a video shared in the conversation.

Android Zendesk SDK v2.33.0

New:

  • The blockChatInput property is now supported for all message types, letting you hide the composer whenever needed.
  • Added support for the following messaging events to enable better tracking in external analytics tools:

Proactive Message Displayed

Proactive Message Clicked

Conversation With Agent Requested

Agent Assigned to Conversation

New Conversation Button Clicked

  • Removed desugaring by replacing LocalDateTime with Date: Migrated to the Date API to eliminate the need for desugaring, improving compatibility and simplifying integration for customers.

Fixed:

  • Improved handling of authentication errors (401/403): The SDK no longer clears user data or creates anonymous users on auth failure. Instead, it emits an AuthenticationFailed event and maintains the current state until JWT is refreshed. Added AuthenticationType to ZendeskUser and a new Zendesk.Use the getCurrentUser API to check the auth status.
    This improvement will enable integrators to manage authentication state better, avoiding duplicate users and tickets.
  • Resolved an issue where the CSAT form title appeared as a URL when no title was set.
  • Resolved an issue where tap events weren’t triggered for URLs, emails, and phone numbers in messages sent by agents.
  • Resolved issues with photo uploads failing after app restarts during capture and ensured proper loading states under poor network conditions.
  • Ensured key headings are properly marked with android:accessibilityHeading=true so TalkBack correctly announces them, enhancing navigation for visually impaired users.
  • Marked decorative images as non-accessible and corrected the focus order of interactive elements to ensure a clearer, more logical experience for TalkBack users.
  • Resolved a race condition that caused crashes when the SDK encountered errors during initialization.

App Marketplace

New:
  • Change Requester by ZENCLAB (Support) (paid)
    • Change Requester by ZENCLAB is a tool designed to automate and optimize your ticket assignment process within Zendesk. By leveraging customizable rules and triggers, the app ensures that tickets are automatically assigned to the appropriate requester or agent, reducing manual effort and improving workflow efficiency.

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Talk
  • Messaging and live chat
  • Zendesk Workflow Management (WFM)
  • Knowledge
  • AI Agents Advanced
  • Explore
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: How can I retrieve the URL of a web widget conversation for use in AI Agents - Advanced?
articles.title: How can I retrieve the URL of a web widget conversation for use in AI Agents - Advanced?
articles.body:
Question

How can I retrieve the URL of a Web Widget conversation for use in AI Agents - Advanced?

Answer

You can retrieve the URL of a web widget conversation by using messaging metadata to populate the URL in a custom ticket field.

The workflow includes the steps below.

  • Step 1: Create the custom text ticket field
  • Step 2: Create the AI agent action
  • Step 3: Add the Web Widget JavaScript

Step 1: Create the custom text ticket field

  1. Create a checkbox ticket field and name it URL. Under the Permissions section, select Customers can edit.
  2. Add the created text field to all the ticket forms your agents use for messaging conversations with customers.
  3. Access your ticket fields to copy the URL ticket field ID.

Step 2: Create the AI agent action

  1. Select your Messaging AI Agent and click into Settings > CRM Integration to ensure that Sunshine Conversations is authorized. If it is not, you can click Add CRM integration and select Messaging to get started.
  2. Create an action with the following:
    • Name | Get URL
    • Targets | Sunshine Conversations
    • Task | Get Conversation
    • Field to retrieve | Metadata
    • Key | Paste the the value zen:ticket_field:<fieldId> and replace the <fieldId> with the ticket ID from step 1.
  3. Set the action to run in your workflow. If you would like it to run at the beginning of every conversation, you can go to Settings > AI Agent Settings > Events and Actions and click in the top right to Add action then select Conversation started and finally select the action from the previous step.

Step 3: Add the Web Widget JavaScript

  1. Add the following code to the website or help center that the Web Widget is embedded. Replace the <fieldId> value with the field ID from step 1:

    <script>
zE('messenger:set', 'conversationFields', [{ id: '<fieldId>', value: window.location.href }]);
</script>

    If you are adding this JavaScript to a help center, include it in the script.js template. For more information, see the article: Customizing the CSS or JavaScript

  2. The URL will now be recorded in the messaging metadata as part your AI Agents - Advanced workflows.
Note: This article is provided for instructional purposes only. Zendesk does not support or guarantee the code. Zendesk also can't provide support for third-party technologies such as JavaScript, jQuery, or CSS. Post any issues you have in the comments section or try searching for a solution online.

For more information, see this article: Using messaging metadata with the Zendesk Web Widget and SDKs

articles.name: Service Incident - August 14, 2025 - Multiple Pods | SunCo - Meta apps account integration issue
articles.title: Service Incident - August 14, 2025 - Multiple Pods | SunCo - Meta apps account integration issue
articles.body:
SUMMARY

From August 14 13:24 UTC to 19:05 UTC, Zendesk customers had issues connecting their Meta apps accounts. This was a vendor issue and was resolved when the vendor implemented a fix on their end.


TIMELINE

August 14, 2025 19:05 UTC | August 14, 2025 14:06 AM PT

We are happy to report the issues related to the Meta Apps, Instagram and Facebook Messenger are now resolved. We thank you for your patience.

August 14, 2025 13:24 UTC | August 14, 2025 06:24 AM PT

We have received reports of customers experiencing difficulties connecting their Meta apps accounts. Our engineers have identified that the root cause lies with the vendor, and we have engaged with them to help resolve the issue.
We apologize for the inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your patience as our team collaborates closely with the vendor to implement a fix.

 

POST-MORTEM

Root Cause Analysis

The issue was caused by a service disruption from our vendor. No Zendesk owned systems were involved, and we alerted our customers when reports were received indicating issues.

 

Resolution

Our vendor resolved the issue on their side, at which time functionality was fully restored for Zendesk customers. 

 

Remediation Items

As this was a vendor issue, no remediation tasks are planned for Zendesk systems or processes.

 

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Service Incident - August 13, 2025 - All pods | AI Agents - AI Agent delays
articles.title: Service Incident - August 13, 2025 - All pods | AI Agents - AI Agent delays
articles.body:
SUMMARY

August 14, 2025 09:05 UTC | August 13. 2025 09:27 AM PT

We are pleased to inform you that the latency issue affecting AI Agents has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as our team worked to address this matter.

 

August 13, 2025 16:27 UTC | August 13. 2025 02:05 AM PT

Our engineers have observed improvements in the latency metrics for AI Agent responses. We are actively monitoring system activity to confirm that the issue has been fully resolved.

Thank you for your patience and understanding. We will continue to provide updates as more information becomes available.

 

August 13, 2025 15:38 UTC | August 13, 2025 08:38 AM PT

We are aware of increased latency in AI Agent bot responses. Some delays approaching up to one minute. We are actively investigating the issue and will update you with more information as soon as it is available.

 

POST-MORTEM

TBD

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Developer update: Enhanced security guidelines for third-party apps, integrations, and bots
articles.title: Developer update: Enhanced security guidelines for third-party apps, integrations, and bots
articles.body:
Zendesk has updated the policies that guide development of public applications, integrations, and bots on our APIs, leveraging modern API security technology and enforcing sensible, consistent patterns. These new policies are designed to prioritize data security and privacy without compromising the flexibility developers expect.

These changes are aimed at giving customers more confidence in the applications and integrations built on Zendesk’s platform. It will increase their visibility into who is accessing their data, and give Zendesk greater ability to protect that data from misuse.

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What's changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?
  • What is coming?

What's changing?

  • All apps and integrations built for distribution to multiple Zendesk customers must be submitted to the Zendesk Marketplace for review and approval. Learn about publishing bots, apps, and themes on the Zendesk Marketplace.
  • All apps, integrations and bots must follow the new standards and guidelines. This does not apply to private apps built by customers for their own internal use.
    • Public apps are built on the Zendesk App framework. If your public ZAF app needs to make server side calls to the Zendesk APIs, it’s required to use a global OAuth client. Preview apps that are built for multiple Zendesk customers must follow the same guidelines.
    • Integration apps (also known as Marketing-only apps) are required to use a global OAuth client and each API call must include custom headers that specify the name of the integration, the organization ID, and the Marketplace app ID.
      • Zendesk will be releasing a new page in Admin Center where customers can view and manage integrations that are using global OAuth access tokens.
      • Supporting the refresh token flow will be required for all global OAuth clients starting January 31, 2026.
    • Bots are built following the Marketplace bot guidelines.
  • It is not permissible for any third-party app, integration or bot (whether it’s listed on the Zendesk Marketplace or not) to use a customer’s API credentials (API token or a customer’s own OAuth client) to authenticate API calls.
  • You’re required to conform to rules about handling customer data, ensuring it is not misused or exposed to undue risk. We are introducing new limitations on how you can use customer data as outlined in the Zendesk Developer Terms.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

The security of our APIs and the applications and integrations built on them is more important than ever. As threats like data exfiltration continue to rise year over year, our customers need confidence that their data is protected. Ensuring that all Marketplace applications, integrations and bots follow security best practices—including strong authentication, secure development, and data protection—and undergo formal review by Zendesk is key to maintaining that trust. You can read more in our blog post.

What do I need to do?

You can start making any necessary changes to your existing app, integration, or bot, today. When you’re ready, you will submit your app (or your bot) for Zendesk Marketplace review and approval. If you currently use API tokens or basic authentication with your integration to authenticate with Zendesk APIs, you will need to update your authentication method to use OAuth. Once the change is completed, you will need to submit an update to your existing listing in the Marketplace.

Zendesk will also be reaching out to third-party app developers with details and time frames for adopting the new standards and guidelines for your existing apps and integrations. 

If you haven’t listed your integration on the Zendesk Marketplace, you need to create your Zendesk Marketplace profile, register your organization and submit your app for review and approval.

To ensure a smooth transition for customers when rolling out the change to using OAuth, you can either: 

  • Perform a hard cutover. Your customers will all be impacted at the same time and will be required to re-authorize their app or integration. You want to communicate this change to impacted customers in advance to minimize impact.

  • Perform a soft cutover and allow your customers to continue to authenticate their calls with the existing authorization implementation until they re-authorize the integration with OAuth. 

Starting today, new submissions to the Zendesk Marketplace will be reviewed and approved based on the new standards and guidelines.

What's coming?

Zendesk will continue to modernize and improve the security of our APIs and associated apps, integrations, and bots over time, with better observability and control over the traffic that comes to and from the apps and integrations that customers enable.

articles.name: Troubleshooting HTML block issues in the new article editor
articles.title: Troubleshooting HTML block issues in the new article editor
articles.body:
What's my plan?
All Suites Team, Growth, Professional, Enterprise, or Enterprise Plus
Support with Guide Professional or Enterprise

Zendesk introduced a new article editor in accounts in Q2 2025. During the transition to the new editor, you may notice that certain articles created in the legacy article editor appear to be wrapped in an HTML block when opened in the new article editor.

This article explains why the issue occurs and how to resolve it.

This article contains the following sections:
  • Understanding why HTML block issues occur
  • Fixing HTML block issues in the new article editor

Understanding why HTML block issues occur

HTML block issues occur because the legacy article editor and new article editor are built on two different rich text editors that process HTML in different ways. The new article editor uses more structured HTML to generate a cleaner and more predictable output, and therefore does not always support the custom HTML code that may exist in your legacy articles.

If a legacy article contains custom HTML that is unsupported in the new editor, the article content is wrapped in an HTML block. Wrapping custom HTML in an HTML block helps the new editor recognize and render your code correctly. Without this, the new article editor may misinterpret your HTML, leading to layout problems or unexpected formatting during publishing.

The following image illustrates what you'll see if you open an affected article in the new article editor. Note that while the content is wrapped in an HTML block, you're still able to preview and publish the original article.

Fixing HTML block issues in the new article editor

For the long term, it's recommended that you update your article code to remove unsupported or custom HTML to be compatible with the new article editor. However, since this can take time to do, you can use any of the following strategies to edit and publish your articles until you're ready to upgrade them:
  • Leave the article as-is and continue to publish in the new article editor
  • Revert the article to the legacy editor
  • Edit the source code in the HTML block
  • Unlink the HTML block and fix the underlying compatibility issue

Leave the article as-is and continue to publish in the new article editor

When to use: This solution is appropriate if:
  • Your article content is stable and you don't anticipate having to make any edits or additions to the content.
  • You use an API to create articles and only use the new article editor to preview and publish.

Description: You can leave the article in the HTML block and continue publishing in the new article editor. Because the HTML block protects the custom HTML code in your article, you can continue to publish the article without making changes.

Drawback: If you need to edit article content, you'll have to use one of the other options listed below.

Revert the article to the legacy editor

When to use: You need to edit content quickly but plan to fix the issue before the legacy editor is sunset.

This option is only available if you have not yet saved the article in the new article editor. Once you save an article in the new editor, any content that was broken during the migration to the new editor will remain, regardless of the editor you are using. This means that in order to retain the original HTML from the legacy article, you can open and preview the article in the new editor, but must switch back to the legacy editor before saving the article.

Description: While the legacy editor is still supported for editing existing articles, you can click the "Switch to legacy editor" button in the Article settings pane of the article editor. The article will open in the legacy editor, where you can continue to edit, save, and publish as you did before.

Drawback: The legacy editor will eventually be sunset and no longer available for use. Before this happens, it's recommended that you identify and resolve issues involving HTML that is unsupported in the new article editor.

Edit the source code in the HTML block

When to use: You're are familiar with HTML code and have minor edits to make to an affected article (for example, editing text).

Description: You can edit code within an HTML block to make changes to the content without removing the protective HTML block from the article. When you use this option to edit content and apply your changes within the HTML block editor, your updates will be saved and visible in all articles and content blocks that contain the HTML block. You do not need to republish the articles for the changes to appear.

Drawback: You must be familiar with HTML code to use this option, since you'll be making all edits in the source code editor. In addition, you must remember that when you update content in an HTML block and apply your changes, it automatically appears in all published articles.

Unlink the HTML block and fix the underlying compatibility issue

When to use: You are an HTML developer who can identify and resolve the unsupported HTML code issue. You want to upgrade the article to be fully compliant with the new article editor so other authors can edit content directly in the editor.

Description: You can unlink HTML blocks to inline the HTML block and remove any unsupported markup from the content. You can preview the code that will be removed prior to unlinking it. Once content is unlinked and unsupported code is removed, you can edit the article in the new article editor and publish it when you're ready. See Unlinking HTML blocks.

Drawback: This option requires developer resources to complete, but is the preferred solution for long-term article maintenance in the new article editor.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-08-08
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-08-08
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • Support
  • Admin Center
  • Messaging and live chat
  • App Marketplace
  • Products with no updates this week

Support

New:

  • When adding a new external email support address, the “Connect other” option is no longer available. The “Connect external address” option now incorporates both workflows in a single selection.

Admin Center

New:

  • As part of the removal of support for password access for API authentication, we proactively turned off and removed this capability for accounts where our records show no usage of the feature for more than the past 90 days. 

Messaging and live chat

New:

  • Admins can now ban IP addresses in messaging to block all users coming from specific IP addresses, making it especially effective against bad actors who evade bans by creating multiple accounts. Learn more

App Marketplace

New:
  • Admin AI (Support - paid)
    • Admin AI lets you ask questions about your account in free text. Admin AI is the fastest, easiest way to understand why your triggers ran (or didn’t). With a sleek, conversational interface, you can simply ask questions about any trigger and ticket, and get clear, accurate answers in seconds.
  • Subscription Pro - Sell (Sell)
    • Subscription Pro consolidates customer subscription data from Zendesk clients into one unified view in Zendesk Sell. Stop switching between platforms—give your sales team all the insights they need, right where they work. See active plans, renewal dates, MRR, and usage metrics on each Company or Contact record. Access real-time subscription insights to understand account health and spot expansion opportunities. Keep all stakeholders informed with accurate, consolidated subscription data.
  • Universal Toolkit by LEAFWORKS (Support - paid)
    • Universal Toolkit by LEAFWORKS combines seven specialized apps designed to simplify and structure your support processes, without additional interfaces, directly within your existing Zendesk instance.  As part of this package, you get Side Tickets Premium, Attachments Manager, Deeplinks Plus, Conditional Fields, Ticket Manager Plus, Related tickets, and Alert Wrong User. All are available independently in the Zendesk Marketplace.
  • Bulk End User Edit (Support - paid)
    • Bulk End User Edit transforms how you manage large numbers of end users in Zendesk. This powerful tool enables administrators to efficiently perform bulk operations through an intuitive interface, saving hours of manual work while ensuring data consistency across your user database.  Find users quickly with multiple filter criteria, including name, email, organization, tags, and custom fields. Update multiple users simultaneously - assign companies, manage tags, and modify custom field values in one operation
  • ShippingBo Connector by Volvox (Support - paid)
    • ShippingBo Connector by Volvox connects your Zendesk Support account with ShippingBo.  Effortlessly retrieve order details directly from a ticket field with autosearch by order ID.  Instantly view detailed billing and shipping information related to the ticket.  Access comprehensive parcel tracking details with ease.

Products with no updates this week

  • Copilot
  • Talk
  • Zendesk Workflow Management (WFM)
  • Knowledge
  • AI Agents Advanced
  • Mobile
  • Explore
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: Workflow: How to proactively reach users on WhatsApp channel
articles.title: Workflow: How to proactively reach users on WhatsApp channel
articles.body:
Integrating a WhatsApp channel with Zendesk signifies that your number is now incorporated into the WhatsApp Business Platform. This integration enables you to receive messages from your users and respond to them during what WhatsApp designates as the customer service window. This means you can reply to a customer within 24 hours of their last message. If the 24-hour window has passed, or if you want to proactively reach out for marketing or informational purposes, you can use WhatsApp templates.

The workflow includes the steps below.

  • Step 1: Understanding WhatsApp templates
  • Step 2: Creating templates
  • Step 3: Sending templates to end users

Step 1: Understanding WhatsApp templates

Templates are pre-approved messages created in advance and approved by WhatsApp. Marketing templates may incur a cost, while utility templates are often free of charge. For more information about templates see the articles:

  • WhatsApp Business Platform Message Template Guidelines
  • Pricing on the WhatsApp Business Platform

Step 2: Creating templates

Once your WhatsApp channel has been created, you can navigate in your Meta Business Suite settings page and log into your WhatsApp business account to create templates.

To create the the templates, see the article: Create message templates for your WhatsApp Business account

Once Meta approves the template, you can start sending it.

Step 3: Sending templates to end users

Determine the purpose of the template:

  • Do you want to reply to a user in a ticket 24 hours after their last message? You can do this using a simple macro, which is explained in this article.
  • Do you want to proactively reach out to users? To do this, you'll need a Suite Professional or Enterprise plan.

Use the following methods to send templates to end users. To do so, you’ll need to generate a Conversation API key  in your Zendesk account.

  • Apps

    The Zendesk Marketplace offers various apps that allow you to send templates, including our in-house developed app, Relay. For more information, see the article: Installing and using the Relay messaging app.

  • Notification API

    You can send templates directly using the Notification API. The Notification API provides more advanced customization options, allowing you to interact with the WhatsApp API to send templates. For more information, see the article: Outbound messaging with the notification API.

articles.name: Service Incident - August 8th, 2025 - Support | All Pods - Workflow disruptions in bulk editing and ticket merge
articles.title: Service Incident - August 8th, 2025 - Support | All Pods - Workflow disruptions in bulk editing and ticket merge
articles.body:
SUMMARY

Between August 7 and August 8, 2025, some Zendesk Support customers experienced problems with workflows such as bulk ticket updates and ticket merging. These issues impacted all Pods but primarily Pod 17 and 20 were impacted.

TIMELINE

August 8, 2025 12:44 AM UTC | August 7, 2025 05:44 PM PT

We are pleased to inform you that the issue affecting Support has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and cooperation throughout this process.

August 8, 2025 12:01 AM UTC | August 7, 2025 05:01 PM PT

We are aware of an issue affecting Support, where customers are experiencing workflow disruptions related to delays in background job processing, including failed bulk updates and the inability to merge tickets. Our engineering team is actively addressing the problem, and we are beginning to observe performance improvements. We will continue to provide updates as we investigate further. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

 

POST-MORTEM

Root-Cause Analysis

A recent change to how we handle background tasks (jobs that run behind the scenes to keep your workflows moving) had overly restrictive job scheduling. When a small number of accounts performed very large operations, our system became overloaded and could not keep up. This led to a backlog of tasks, which meant that some customer actions took much longer than usual or failed altogether.

Resolution

As soon as we discovered the problem, our engineering teams:

  • Stopped the new background job process in the most affected areas, then across the whole platform, to prevent the issue from getting worse.
  • Cleared out the backlog of stuck jobs so that normal processing could resume.
  • Closely monitored system health to make sure all customer workflows were restored.

Remediation Items

We are taking several steps to prevent this from happening again:

  • Adding new limits and safeguards to stop any single account from overloading the system.
  • Improving how we manage and prioritize background tasks, especially during busy times.
  • Updating our monitoring so we can spot and fix similar issues  faster.

 

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Announcing the Marketplace partner developer support
articles.title: Announcing the Marketplace partner developer support
articles.body:
Zendesk is excited to announce that we've created a new support process specifically for Marketplace partner developers!  We are introducing a new direct line to a team that can help you when you require support with your integrations. With this new, direct line, we hope to simplify our support process and get you the support you deserve!

This announcement includes the following topics:

  • What is changing?
  • Why is Zendesk making this change?
  • What do I need to do?

What is changing?

You can reach out to the new Marketplace Partner Developer Support by emailing any questions or issues you have directly to partner_support@zendesk.com. A dedicated team will review and triage your tickets to ensure clear and accurate routing. If you use the existing Support web widget to get in touch, specify that you are a “Marketplace Partner” so your tickets are routed to the appropriate team.

Why is Zendesk making this change?

Zendesk recognizes the importance of specialized, efficient support to Marketplace partner developers. As integrations become more complex, developers need a dedicated channel that understands their unique challenges. This new support process and direct process ensures that developers receive timely help tailored specifically to their integration needs.

Types of issues handled by Marketplace Partner Developer Support:

  • Problems or questions related to your integrations listed in the Marketplace
  • Issues or bugs with Zendesk products that impact your integrations

How is this different from Marketplace Operations?

Marketplace Operations oversees the daily management of the App Marketplace and Marketplace portal. This includes tasks such as publishing and updating apps, themes, bots, and managing public listings and Stripe pricing plane, and coordinating communications with partner developers. Their scope covers: 

  • App submissions and update processes to the Zendesk Marketplace
  • Handling requests related to Global OAuth client creation or modifications
  • Managing sponsored account inquiries
  • Addressing questions about app listing metrics and performances
  • Managing access to the Marketplace portal (apps.zendesk.com)

Marketplace Operations does not provide troubleshooting or support pertaining to the Zendesk App Framework (ZAF) or API issues.

What do I need to do?

No action is required to benefit from this new support process.

If you have feedback or questions related to this announcement, visit our community forum where we collect and manage customer product feedback. For general assistance with your Zendesk products, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

articles.name: Does AI automatically translate articles in my help center if I update the English version?
articles.title: Does AI automatically translate articles in my help center if I update the English version?
articles.body:
Question

Does AI automatically translate articles in my help center if I update the English version? For example, if I update the English copy of an article, will the French translation auto-update?

Answer

Zendesk does not automatically update translations that are generated through the AI translation function. To update your translations, open each translation after you update the English version of the article and use the Translate function to update the content.

For more information, see the article: Translating articles in your help center using AI.

articles.name: Can I add any specific voice or tone requirements to AI agents?
articles.title: Can I add any specific voice or tone requirements to AI agents?
articles.body:
Question

How do I control how an AI agent responds to questions? Can I control the formality when using AI to write content?

Answer

Yes, for AI agents, you can set the tone or voice, such as friendly, formal, enthusiastic within the admin center when publishing the bot. For more information, see the article: Customizing the persona, tone of voice, and pronoun formality for an advanced AI agent. 

For AI-assisted article editing through copilot, you can choose to make content more friendly or more formal depending on your needs.

Copilot supports communication guidelines. This expanded functionality lets admins define detailed writing instructions covering:

  • General communication principles
  • Formatting
  • Tone and voice
  • Length and formality
  • Structure
  • Greetings and closings
  • Writing style and wording

When communication guidelines are enabled and defined, auto assist and rewrite in your tone follow these rules while adapting to the ticket context. If there is a conflict between inferred style from the conversation and the defined guidelines, the guidelines take priority.

If communication guidelines are enabled but no rules are defined, the tools rely on the ticket conversation only. If disabled, rewrite in your tone is unavailable and auto assist will not follow any predefined rules.

articles.name: How do I use labels to help AI agents suggest articles to users?
articles.title: How do I use labels to help AI agents suggest articles to users?
articles.body:
Question

Do labels help the AI tool in messaging locate appropriate articles and serve them up? How do AI agents weigh which articles are the most relevant or important?

Answer

You can use the labels to specify articles that should be used in autoreplies. For example, if there is an article that AI agents should consider and suggest, you can add the label use_for_autoreply to that article. You can also create differentiated labels based on the type of user, such as iOS and Android to articles with content specific to different platform segments.

It is important to create concise, focused content and to simplify your content wherever possible. For AI functions, it is better to have several short articles that each answer one question rather than fewer broad articles. Titles, labels, and article content all play a role in how AI surfaces and suggests an article. For more information, see the article: Best practices: Optimizing for autoreplies with articles

Keep your labels short and concise. Labels help surface articles in searches and improve AI recommendations, and the title of the article and first 45 words of the article body are weighted more heavily than labels. If articles are not appearing in suggestions as expected, first optimize your article titles and content, then review your labels. For more information, see the article: Optimizing your help center content for AI agents.

articles.name: Release notes through 2025-08-01
articles.title: Release notes through 2025-08-01
articles.body:
See our What's New for an overview of what was released last month.

This week's release notes include:

  • Chat and messaging
  • Copilot
  • Talk
  • App Marketplace
  • Zendesk Workforce Management (WFM)
  • Products with no updates this week

Chat and messaging

New:

  • Customers can define goals (purchases and renewals) and track the performance of agents on the goals.
  • Customers can now end sessions and release capacity of agents with an inactivity timer or with a final reminder.
  • Banning IPs allows admins to block all users coming from a specific IP address, making it especially effective against bad actors who evade bans by creating multiple accounts.

Copilot

New:

  • Auto assist can now provide direct instructions for agents in the knowledge section in the context panel.

Talk

New: 

  • Professional and Enterprise customers using  Voice with omnichannel routing can now set a maximum queue size of up to 1,500 directly in  their Voice settings. The previous self‑service limit was 60, with higher caps requiring contact with Zendesk support.

App Marketplace

New:
  • Merge Duplicate WhatsApp Users (Support)
    • Merge Duplicate WhatsApp Users automatically merges duplicate users created by WhatsApp.  Every time a new user is created from a WhatsApp message, the app checks the phone number against your customer base for matches. If a matching user already exists in Zendesk, the app instantly merges them, invisibly to your team, before any misunderstandings can occur. Your agents can then continue seamlessly from where they left off in their conversation with the customer.
  • Auto Merge 2025 (Support)
    • Auto Merge 2025 automatically detects and solves duplicate tickets across all channels according to your business logic. For example, if a customer submits the same request twice through your web portal and once by WhatsApp, the three requests will result in only one ticket.
  • Fini (Support)
    • Fini is an AI agent that helps automate customer support operations with 80% accuracy.  Fini doesn’t just answer, it learns from your real support tickets, understands context and emotion, and takes precise actions to resolve the majority of your support volume. When needed, it smoothly hands off complex cases to your team, with complete conversation and action history. Instantly surface deep insights and AI-powered suggestions to maximize performance, reduce manual effort, and uncover new automation opportunities across support channels

Zendesk Workforce Management (WFM)

New:

  • The new tracking browser extension is being gradually rolled out to all accounts subscribed to Zendesk WFM. Rollout is projected to end by August 11th, 2025.

Fixed:

  • Tracking - Support. Fixed a scenario where tracking Support activity across multiple browser tabs would not recognize opening a Support tab in a non-ticket view as a new tracking event. Focusing on a Support page in any non-ticket view after visiting any non-Support page will now dispatch an untracked activity as expected.
  • WFM Agent Notifications. In certain conditions, the alert of upcoming changes in scheduled activities wasn't updating. We fixed this to ensure that the notification is now reliably sent, and increased the time that the notification hangs in the Support notification area to 10 seconds.

Products with no updates this week

  • Support
  • Admin Center
  • Knowledge
  • AI Agents Advanced
  • Mobile
  • Explore
  • Zendesk QA

articles.name: Service Incident - August 04, 2025 - Zendesk QA - Assignments stuck on pending on multiple workspaces for several accounts
articles.title: Service Incident - August 04, 2025 - Zendesk QA - Assignments stuck on pending on multiple workspaces for several accounts
articles.body:
Summary

On July 05,2025, between 8:00 and 14:00 UTC, we received 5 reports of customers hosted on Google Cloud Platform experiencing issues with agent status values not updating correctly.

Timeline

August 04, 2025 15:45 UTC | August 04, 2025 8:45 AM PT

We have received reports of some customers experiencing assignments getting stuck in Pending status within the Zendesk QA service. Our engineering team has deployed a fix and is actively monitoring the system to ensure stability.
We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and appreciate your patience as we continue to address the situation.

August 04, 2025 19:02 UTC | August 04, 2025 12:02 PM PT

Zendesk QA assignments being stuck in Pending status has been resolved for nearly all customers. If you continue to see these issues in your account please submit a ticket so we can investigate further.

August 06, 2025 14:57 UTC | August 06, 2025 07:57 AM PT

We are pleased to inform you that the issue causing some customers’ assignments to get stuck in Pending status within the Zendesk QA service has been resolved. 
Thank you for your patience and understanding while our team worked diligently to address this matter.

Root Cause Analysis

This incident was caused by a problem with the agent status page for customers using Google Cloud Platform, which caused incorrect information to appear. This was due to a slow database query pulling too much data. 

Resolution

To fix this issue, the team limited the data used and optimized the query. Engineering also corrected any inaccurate information from the incident as part of the fix.

Remediation Items

  1. Set up alerts to notify the team by email if data stops coming in or if there is a delay in the system.
  2. Reduce unnecessary alerts from the Kafka system to focus on the most important issues.

 

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: Error: Redaction failed – wait a moment, then try again
articles.title: Error: Redaction failed – wait a moment, then try again
articles.body:
Issue symptoms

I'm attempting to redact sensitive information on a ticket, but the system returns the error message: Redaction failed – wait a moment, then try again.

Resolution steps

The error Redaction failed – wait a moment, then try again can occur when redacting sensitive information, such as passwords or credit card numbers, in tickets. This issue often occurs when using the Web Widget (Classic) or handling active messaging conversations. It is commonly associated with 401 unauthorized or 422 unprocessable entity errors.

Below are some common reasons this could occur:

  • Unauthorized access

    This error may occur if the Anybody can submit tickets setting is disabled in your Zendesk instance. When this feature is disabled, the Web Widget (Classic) cannot be used to submit a ticket. For more information, see the article: Enabling anyone to submit tickets.

  • Support address conflict

    When using the Web Widget (Classic), this error may appear if the requester is set to a support address, which is typically already associated with your Zendesk account. Ensure the requester is not using a support address.

  • Active messaging conversations

    Redaction is not allowed in active messaging conversations. To proceed, wait until the conversation becomes inactive or manually update the ticket status to pending, on-hold, or solved before attempting redaction.

  • Browser issues

    Clear the cache and cookies of your browser, as this can help resolve issues caused by outdated or corrupted browser data.

  • App conflicts

    Browser extensions or apps installed in your Zendesk instance can sometimes interfere with the redaction process.

    • To troubleshoot browser extensions, disable them one at a time to identify the source of the issue.
    • To isolate potential app-related issues, test without any Zendesk apps enabled by adding ?noapps to the end of the ticket URL. For more information see the article: Troubleshoot app issues in Zendesk account.

  • Zendesk system errors

    In rare cases, temporary issues within Zendesk may cause redaction attempts to fail. In these situations, wait briefly and try again later.

articles.name: Why do I see occasional agent status gaps when monitoring agent activity in Zendesk WFM?
articles.title: Why do I see occasional agent status gaps when monitoring agent activity in Zendesk WFM?
articles.body:
Question

Why do I see occasional agent status gaps when monitoring agent activity in Zendesk WFM?

Answer

When you monitor agent activity in real time, you may occasionally observe very short intervals where an agent’s status doesn’t immediately update. This is a natural result of how data flows through modern distributed systems, and how Zendesk WFM processes events in micro‑batches to balance speed and reliability.

  • Why it happens: To ensure high availability and consistency, Zendesk WFM groups rapid status changes into small data windows before it presents them in the UI. This approach prevents dropped events during network blips or momentary high load.
  • What you see: A fraction‑of‑a‑second delay in status updates, typically less than 2 to 3 seconds, during periods of exceptionally rapid activity or transient connectivity fluctuations.
  • Why you can trust it: Even during these brief windows, Zendesk WFM records every single event.

For more information, see this article: About the Agent activity page.

articles.name: Excluding terms from AI-generated translations
articles.title: Excluding terms from AI-generated translations
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Add-on Copilot

You can configure AI translations to exclude case-sensitive specific words or phrases that you don't want to be translated. For example, adding your brand names to the excluded terms list ensures that these names remain in the source language, and are consistent across all of your translations.

This article contains the following topics:

  • Adding an excluded term
  • Editing an excluded term
  • Deleting an excluded term

Related articles:

  • Turning on and off the translate knowledge base articles generative AI feature
  • Translating articles in your help center using AI

Adding an excluded term

You can add a word or phrase to the excluded term list to ensure that they are not translated during AI-generated translations.

To add a word or phrase to the excluded terms list

  1. In Admin Center, click AI in the sidebar, then select Agent copilot > Translations.
  2. Under Exclude terms from translations, click Manage excluded terms.

  3. On the Excluded terms page, click Add terms.
  4. In the Terms and phrases to exclude field, add the terms that you want to exclude from translations, separated by commas.
    Note: Commas are treated as separators between different terms. If you want to exclude a longer phrase that contains commas, you must precede each comma within the phrase with a backslash (/). For example, to treat the phrase "apples, oranges, and bananas" as a single excluded phrase, you must enter it in the text field as "apples\, oranges\, and bananas".

  5. Click Save.

Editing an excluded term

If you need to update or change an excluded term, you can edit the excluded term directly from the excluded terms list.

To edit an excluded term
  1. In Admin Center, click AI in the sidebar, then select Agent copilot > Translations.
  2. Under Exclude terms from translations, click Manage excluded terms.

  3. Select the option icon () for the term that you want to edit, then select Edit term.

  4. In the Edit term modal, enter your changes in the text field, then click Save.

Deleting an excluded term

You can delete any excluded terms that you no longer want the AI-generated translation to ignore. Once you delete an excluded term, it will be translated along with the rest of your article content unless you add it to the excluded terms list again.

To delete an excluded term
  1. In Admin Center, click AI in the sidebar, then select Agent copilot > Translations.
  2. Under Exclude terms from translations, click Manage excluded terms.

  3. Select the option icon () for the term that you want to delete, then select Delete.
  4. Click Delete.

articles.name: Service Incident - July 31, 2025 - All Pods | Zendesk Sales - Performance degradation and failing calls
articles.title: Service Incident - July 31, 2025 - All Pods | Zendesk Sales - Performance degradation and failing calls
articles.body:
Summary

Between July 27, 2025, 08:30 UTC and August 08, 2025, 06:25 UTC, we received 48 customer reports regarding performance degradation impacting the Zendesk Sales (Sell) service. Upon investigation, it was determined that the user account “Persimmon” was generating an unusually high volume of appointment messages, which contributed significantly to the service degradation.

Timeline

July 31, 2025 17:50 UTC | July 31, 2025 10:50 PT

We are investigating performance issues for customers using Zendesk Sales (Sell) across all pods. Impact includes failing calls, slow performance, and issues with imports/exports. Our engineers are adding resources and continue to investigate and monitor the situation.

July 31, 2025 6:51 UTC | July 31, 2025 11:51 PT

Issues with Zendesk Sales Voice and live data services are now resolved. We continue to address performance issues with other services of Zendesk Sales. Some searches may not return recently created items. We will update when this data has been processed.

August 04, 2025 15:30 UTC | August 04, 2025 8:30 AM PT

Our engineering team has deployed a targeted update to address the recent performance degradation affecting Zendesk Sell services. This fix is now live and under close monitoring. If you continue to experience any performance issues with Zendesk Sell, please contact us promptly so we can provide immediate assistance.Thank you for your patience and understanding.

August 05, 2025 12:55 UTC | August 05, 2025 05:55 AM PT

Our engineers continue to closely monitor system activity following the deployment of a fix for the recent performance degradation affecting Zendesk Sell. We would appreciate your feedback on whether the issue has been resolved on your end. Your input will enable us to assist you more effectively. Thank you for your cooperation.

August 06, 2025 15:39 UTC | August 06, 2025 8:39 AM PT

As our engineers continue to work on the performance issues related to the Zendesk Sales product, we have finished processing a backlog of records that contributed to the issues related to inaccurate or "stale" reporting data. We observe that no further issues are present in reporting and we continue to monitor to ensure full recovery. Please let us know if you continue to experience any issues in either live data or historical data accuracy and product functionality.

August 08, 2025 06:06 UTC | August 07, 2025 11:06 PM PT

We are pleased to inform you that the performance issues with Zendesk Sales (Sell) have been resolved. Thank you for your patience and cooperation while we worked to address this matter.

Root Cause Analysis

The root cause of this incident was identified as an unusually high volume of appointment messages generated by the user account “Persimmon,” which significantly contributed to the degradation of service performance.

Resolution

To resolve the issue, engineers transferred the messages to the RabbitMQ broker and cleared nearly 170,000 “appointment” messages originating from the affected user account.

Remediation Items

  1. Revisit all RMQ-related alerts to ensure comprehensive coverage including restarts, crashes, error rate increases, and disk-related metrics per queue. Verify alert thresholds and update playbook links accordingly.
  2. Update and refine playbooks for RabbitMQ (RMQ) incidents, including specific procedures for the RabbitQOS service and guidelines for handling offenders.
  3. Review services that upscaled during the incident, such as the sell-hoarder service. Correct and update resource limits, consider implementing or calibrating Horizontal Pod Autoscaling (HPA), and adjust existing resource requests as necessary.
  4. Perform broker deletions and other necessary cleanup work. Investigate the possibility of fixing payload issues originating from the sell-appointment service to improve system stability.

FOR MORE INFORMATION

For current system status information about Zendesk and specific impacts to your account, visit our system status page. You can follow this article to be notified when our post-mortem report is published. If you have additional questions about this incident, contact Zendesk customer support.

articles.name: How do app users change their agent status?
articles.title: How do app users change their agent status?
articles.body:
Question

How do mobile app users change their agent status?

Answer

At the moment, Zendesk doesn't support the update of the agent status through the Zendesk Support mobile app. To update your omnichannel status, log into the browser version of Zendesk.

The Zendesk Support mobile app allows agents to interact with messaging conversations already assigned. However, agents can't accept and action conversations from omnichannel routing directly in the app.

articles.name: Why is my customized RegEX not working in AI agents - Advanced?
articles.title: Why is my customized RegEX not working in AI agents - Advanced?
articles.body:
Issue symptoms

When creating an entity in an advanced AI agent, you can define rules using regular expressions (RegEx) to match different data sets.

For example, if you're using a regular expression to match a mix of letters and numbers between 5 and 20 characters long, you might be tempted to use the following pattern:

(?=.*\d)[A-Za-z0-9-]{5,20}

Although this regular expression is technically correct, it doesn't work when tested in the AI Agent.

The issue relates to the use of positive lookahead syntax, as shown in the image below. While regex101.com confirms that the expression correctly matches the dataset, it relies on positive lookahead, which may not be supported in AI Agents – Advanced.

Resolution steps

To resolve this issue effectively, avoid using positive lookahead syntax.

Based on the example above, replace the regular expression with an alternative that doesn't use positive lookahead:

[A-Za-z-]*\d[A-Za-z0-9-]{4,19}

For more information, see this article: Creating entities in conversation flows for advanced AI agents

articles.name: Installing AWS CloudFormation stack to support Zendesk for Contact Center
articles.title: Installing AWS CloudFormation stack to support Zendesk for Contact Center
articles.body:
What's my plan?
Add-on Zendesk for Contact Center

The AWS CloudFormation stack links your Amazon Connect and Contact Center instances. After your Contact Center instance has been created by Zendesk, you will receive a CloudFormation template URL needed for the installation.

You must have an Amazon Connect instance and a Contact Center instance before you can install your AWS CloudFormation stack.

To install the Contact Center CloudFormation stack

  1. In the AWS Management Console, make sure that Kinesis Stream data streaming (not Kinesis Firehose) is enabled for the Amazon Connect instance connected to the deployment.

  2. Open your Amazon Console in the region where your Amazon Connect instance resides, then scroll to the bottom of the page showing details about the stack being installed.
  3. Accept the terms, then start the stack installation.

    The installation process might take up to 15 minutes. When it's complete, the status appears as CREATE_COMPLETE next to the new stack in the Amazon Console.

After the stack installation completes, inform the Zendesk team that created the Contact Center instance so that they can activate the stack to link the Contact Center instance to your Amazon Connect instance.

After the stack has been activated, sign into the Contact Center instance using the login method set up in Amazon Connect, then install the Zendesk for Contact Center app in Zendesk and link it to your Contact Center instance.

articles.name: Why doesn't the condition "Channel is Voicemail" work in triggers and views when omnichannel is enabled?
articles.title: Why doesn't the condition "Channel is Voicemail" work in triggers and views when omnichannel is enabled?
articles.body:
Issue symptoms

I am using Zendesk Talk with omnichannel routing enabled, but notice the condition Channel | Is | Voicemail does not work with my triggers and views to track voicemail tickets.

Zendesk currently handles voicemail tickets differently when calls are routed through omnichannel during active business hours. As a result, the system cannot reliably identify these tickets as voicemails using the standard channel condition. This limitation affects any triggers, automations, or views that rely on this condition, causing them to function incorrectly.

Resolution steps

To accurately track voicemail tickets, create a trigger that automatically adds a specific tag to each voicemail ticket.

To create a trigger to add a tag automatically:

  1. Create a new trigger.
  2. Under Meet ALL of the following conditions, add the conditions below:
    • Ticket > Ticket | Is | Updated
    • Ticket > Subject text | Contains the following string | Voicemail from
  3. Under Actions, add:
    • Ticket > Add tags | special_voicemail
  4. Select Create trigger.

You can now use this tag as a condition in your SLAs, triggers, views, and automations to properly handle voicemail tickets.

For more information, see this article: Working with ticket tags
